sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a trapezium.
message_1: A trapezium has two parallel sides with lengths 5 cm and 10 cm respectively, and two non-parallel sides with lengths 7 cm and 8 cm respectively. What is the perimeter of the trapezium?
message_2:
To find the perimeter of the trapezium, we simply need to add the lengths of all four sides together.

Perimeter = length of first parallel side + length of second parallel side + length of first non-parallel side + length of second non-parallel side

Perimeter = 5 cm + 10 cm + 7 cm + 8 cm

Perimeter = 30 cm

The perimeter of the trapezium is 30 cm.
